sn44.9:3.9: MS punctuates as if the reported converstaion ends here. However, it’s unlikely that the Buddha would be referred to face to face with ayamp samano gotamo, so BB’s punctuation is probably correct.
sn44.9:6.4: In parallel phrases, _aññataraṁ_ qualifies the realm of rebirth (eg. [an6.34:1.5](): _aññataraṁ brahmalokaṁ upapanno_). This must be the meaning of the second _kāya_ here. I read _satto_ as “attached”, since one who has been freed would not be reborn.
